result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Set for status with 22CF446

9:12 AM Defendant Gavin J Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Walter Gleason Mr. appeared by video for Gavin J Jones.  Attorney Paul Humphrey for Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. 
IN CUSTODY
Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued. 
Record made by Atty Gleason regarding prompt dispo. Trial dates set in case 22CF446.

9:55am. Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant in court in custody. Atty Brian Gleason appears by video means with the court approval. State appears by Colleen Lennon. Witness duly sworn and testified. Direct by state. Venue established. Defendant identified. Cross by Atty Gleason. State moves for bind over, waives argument. Defense objects to bind over, gives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over to branch 14.

Court explained to Defn status of attorney appointment. Court discusses prompt disposition and potential future decisions regarding Court making good cause findings to go beyond timelimes as provided in State Statutes and the remaining remedies. Court sets a new hearing date and if an attorney is appointed before that time, a prelim will be set and the hearing will be canceled.

Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to the next in-person court appearance or the conclusion of the case. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

02:01 PM Defendant in court, in custody from Kettle Moraine Correctional with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
